text: now let's talk about how folks other
than amazon.com are adopting serverless
technologies today so let's imagine the
world as a 4x4 graft because that's what
Gartner taught us the world is and we
have legacy architectures that are
monolithic applications but folks really
want to move to more modern
architectures leveraging microservices
and maybe they have a lot of stuff on
Prem they really want to move it up into
the cloud so nirvana and I mean that in
the Seattle way not in the Buddhist way
is over there in the upper right
quadrant so the first step is you could
take your existing architecture you can
put it on ec2 and great you're up in the
cloud you're gonna get efficiencies for
scale and for cost and agility and it's
gonna be great maybe you want to
introduce a little bit more agility into
your operations and so you're going to
use containerization like eks or ECS or
Fargate in order to get to a more micro
service architecture great or maybe you
have a different path and you want to
box everything up into containers first
and then you want to shift it up into
the cloud fantastic but there's another
type of customer who is skipping a bunch
of these steps and is leapfrogging that
adoption and that's a customer like
Fannie Mae Fannie Mae had a legacy of
Monte Carlo application that they were
running on Prem and they thought well
how far can we go with just one jump and
then they were able to leverage lambda
and to run that Monte Carlo simulation
and they got great efficiencies of not
only cost but also not maintaining that
compute when they weren't using it
